newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai police say serial killer on loose.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai police say serial killer on loose.

text.p: A serial killer whose victims are all young women is on the rampage in Shanghai and is being hunted by police, a police spokesman said on Monday.
Rumours circulating in China's biggest city say at least 10 women have been murdered so far, but the official said he was not able to reveal the figure.
"They are all females, no men," the Public Security Bureau official said by telephone.
According to some rumours, the victims were young women with long hair. Others say they also all carried fashionable knapsacks.
The official declined to say how the victims were killed or to reveal any other details of the case.
But he confirmed the killer was still at large.
A senior police source said there would probably be an announcement on the case in the next day or two.
Meanwhile, an official in a police bureau in the Yangpu district in northeast Shanghai said he was aware of "one of two cases" of murder.
"But we're not sure how they are linked," he said.
China's official media have yet to make any reference to the murders, and police rarely make such matters public before cases have been fully resolved.
An official in the Baoshan district of northeast Shanghai, where most of the murders are rumoured to have taken place, said she knew of no such case.
"There must be some mistake," she said. "Nothing like that has happened."
A 42-year-old truck driver was executed in the southern Chinese province of Guangdong in 1995 after being found guilty of murdering 12 young women between 1990 and 1994.
The man strangled them, raped their corpses and then dismembered the bodies.
